episodeTitle: The Encircling Walls Activated! The Whitebeard Pirates Backed into a Corner!
description: The Marines activate their encircling walls to trap the Whitebeard Pirates, but Little Oars Jr.'s fallen body blocks one section. Whitebeard defeats Vice Admiral John Giant with a devastating earthquake punch. Squard receives comfort from Marco after his betrayal. Akainu unleashes his Meteor Volcano attack, melting the ice and eliminating the pirates' path forward.

events.title: Squard's Remorse
events.description: Squard wallows in grief over stabbing Whitebeard after being manipulated by the Marines. He cries in anguish over his betrayal of the man he considered a father figure.
events.significance: Shows the emotional aftermath of Squard's manipulation and establishes the deep bond between Whitebeard and his subordinate captains.

quotes.text: What have I done? I stabbed Pops!
quotes.speaker: Squard
quotes.context: Squard realizes the gravity of his manipulated betrayal

events.title: Marco Comforts Squard
events.description: Marco the Phoenix approaches the grieving Squard and encourages him to repay his debt through action rather than tears. He tells Squard that crying won't help set things right.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Whitebeard Pirates' values of redemption and action over regret. Marco's leadership and compassion shine through.

quotes.text: Will crying help set things right? Go and repay your debt.
quotes.speaker: Marco
quotes.context: Marco encourages Squard to atone through action

events.title: Whitebeard Charges Forward
events.description: Whitebeard leads a ferocious charge into the heart of Marine defenses. His entire crew and allied captains surge forward, creating a path for their captain toward the execution platform.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Whitebeard's all-out assault despite his injuries, demonstrating his unwavering determination to save Ace.

events.title: Vice Admiral John Giant Confronts Whitebeard
events.description: Vice Admiral John Giant, one of the Marine's giant officers, steps forward to confront Whitebeard on the battlefield in an attempt to buy time and stop his advance.
events.significance: Sets up a demonstration of Whitebeard's overwhelming power against even high-ranking Marine officers.

events.title: Whitebeard's Earthquake Tilts Marineford
events.description: Whitebeard unleashes a catastrophic earthquake so massive that the entire island of Marineford tilts to one side. He defeats John Giant with a single quake-infused punch that breaks through the ice and bay, nearly reaching the scaffold.
events.significance: One of the most visually stunning displays of Whitebeard's world-shaking abilities. The feat is so powerful that it alters the physical geography of Marineford and demonstrates why he's called 'The Man Who Can Destroy the World.'

quotes.text: How strong is that old man?!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Three Admirals Stabilize the Execution Platform
events.description: The three admirals - Akainu, Aokiji, and Kizaru - work together to keep the execution platform stable despite Whitebeard's massive earthquakes. They use their combined power to block the shockwave.
events.significance: Demonstrates the coordinated might of the Marine Admirals and their ability to counter even Whitebeard's devastating attacks when working together.

events.title: The Encircling Walls Are Activated
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku orders the activation of massive retaining walls designed to trap the pirate forces. The Marines deploy these walls to surround and contain all of Whitebeard's forces in the bay area.
events.significance: Reveals a major strategic defense mechanism at Marine Headquarters. This tactical move shifts the battle dramatically as the Marines attempt to turn the tide.

quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Sengoku orders the deployment of the Marine's trap

events.title: Aokiji's Ice Blocks the Walls
events.description: The encircling walls initially fail to raise completely because Aokiji's ice from earlier in the battle is blocking their deployment. This creates a comedic moment of inter-Admiral conflict about whose fault it is.
events.significance: Shows an unintended consequence of the Admirals' earlier tactics and provides brief comic relief in an intense battle.

quotes.text: The walls aren't ready yet. That's what's causing this mess.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji explains the wall deployment issue

quotes.speaker: Akainu
quotes.context: Akainu blames Aokiji for the wall malfunction

events.title: Little Oars Jr.'s Body Blocks the Wall
events.description: One section of the encircling wall cannot deploy because Little Oars Jr.'s massive fallen body and blood have interfered with the wall mechanism. His corpse blocks the wall's path and his blood clogs the gears, leaving one critical gap in the Marine's defense.
events.significance: Even in death, Oars Jr. continues to help his allies. This creates the only opening in the otherwise complete encirclement and becomes crucial for the battle's progression.

events.title: Luffy and Allies Continue Their Charge
events.description: Despite the activation of the encircling walls, Luffy, Jinbe, Ivankov, and their allies press forward in their desperate attempt to reach the execution platform and save Ace.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's unwavering determination to save his brother regardless of the obstacles the Marines deploy.

events.title: Akainu Unleashes Meteor Volcano (Ryusei Kazan)
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku orders Akainu to attack. Akainu deploys his devastating 'Ryusei Kazan' (Meteor Volcano) technique, creating a storm of flaming magma fists that he fires into the sky. After a moment of silence, the magma rains down upon the battlefield like meteors, melting the ice and destroying the pirates' path forward. The attack critically damages the Moby Dick.
events.significance: The debut of one of Akainu's most destructive techniques. This attack eliminates the ice battlefield that had been the pirates' path to the execution platform, dramatically shifting the tactical situation and trapping the Whitebeard Pirates.

events.title: The Whitebeard Pirates Driven Into a Corner
events.description: With the encircling walls activated (except for the section blocked by Oars Jr.'s body) and Akainu's Meteor Volcano melting the ice, the Whitebeard Pirates find themselves truly backed into a corner with limited options for advancing or retreating.
events.significance: This represents the culmination of the Marine's strategic planning. The episode's title is realized as the pirates face their most desperate situation yet in the war.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's anguished cry as he realizes the situation is getting worse

quotes.text: Will crying help set things right? Go and repay your debt.
quotes.speaker: Marco
quotes.context: Marco encourages Squard to atone for stabbing Whitebeard

quotes.text: How strong is that old man?!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy witnesses Whitebeard's devastating earthquake power

quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Sengoku orders the deployment of the Marine's tactical trap

themes.description: Squard's remorse and Marco's encouragement to make amends through action rather than regret.
themes.symbolism: The weight of betrayal and the path to redemption through selfless acts.

themes.description: Whitebeard's raw destructive power is countered by the Marines' carefully planned defensive mechanisms.
themes.symbolism: The clash between unstoppable force and immovable object - individual might versus institutional strategy.

themes.description: Little Oars Jr.'s body continues to aid his allies even in death, blocking the encircling wall.
themes.symbolism: The enduring impact of sacrifice and how fallen comrades continue to support their allies.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his world-shaking power and unwavering determination to save Ace despite severe injuries. His earthquake that tilts Marineford itself cements his reputation as the strongest man in the world.

Confronts and defeats Vice Admiral John Giant
Unleashes a massive earthquake that tilts the entire island
Continues fighting despite the Marine's encircling walls

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his leadership qualities and compassionate nature as he helps Squard deal with his guilt.

Melts the ice battlefield to trap the pirates

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his determination to save Ace while acknowledging Whitebeard's incredible strength.

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, the magma fists from Meteor Volcano are shown flying high into the sky and above the clouds before falling back down, as if truly descending from space. The manga shows them more directly. The anime also added a fireworks sound effect during the firing and falling of the fists.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 564 of the manga, titled 'The Man Who Shook the World,' which was originally released on November 21, 2009.
The episode title references both the Marine's tactical deployment of the encircling walls and the desperate situation the Whitebeard Pirates find themselves in.
Kinryu Arimoto, the Japanese voice actor for Whitebeard, was 70 years old when this episode aired. He continued voicing Whitebeard until his passing in 2019 at age 78.
The Meteor Volcano (Ryusei Kazan) technique debuts in this episode and will later play a significant role in the climax of the Marineford War.
During the Marineford arc (episodes 457-489), One Piece episodes featured extended opening themes and no ending themes to maximize story content in each episode.
Little Oars Jr.'s body blocking the encircling wall demonstrates a recurring One Piece theme: even fallen comrades continue to support their allies through their sacrifice.
